data.title: 'Ordinary People' Tops Golden Globe Nominations
data.text:
''Ordinary People,'' ''Raging Bull'' and ''The Stunt Man'' yesterday captured the most nominations for Golden Globe Awards.

The presentations will be made by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association in a nationwide telecast on Jan. 31.

Among the eight nominations for ''Ordinary People'' were the director Robert Redford, the stars Mary Tyler Moore and Donald Sutherland and the supporting actors Judd Hirsch and Timothy Hutton.

''Raging Bull'' and ''The Stunt Man'' each picked up six nominations. Films with four nominations were ''Coal Miner's Daughter,'' ''The Elephant Man,'' ''Fame'' and ''Melvin and Howard.''
